Reviews.Title: “Pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: Geitun
Reviews.Content: Friendly employees, a good and healthy breakfast, nice colors in the room and hallways plus excellent location close to central museums and nice restaurants. Me and my wife recommend this not to expensive hotel in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “good location hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very good. Breakfast is good. Good value. Highly recommended. Only downside is no English TV channel. We spent three nights in this hotel, which gave us plenty of time to see Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Andrea B
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked great, starting from its excellent location right next to Plaza Santa Ana and its parallel/perpendicular streets, which are excellent for going out for dinner/drinking. Of course it's at walking distance from the Puerta del Sol, and from the underground stations. The rooms were clean, quiet, spacious and the furniture looked modern. Wifi was also present, together with included breakfast. Though..once we woke up early not to miss a plane and breakfast was not completely ready..so there was not a lot of choice despite the room was open and ready to receive people. In conclusion, if I have to suggest a hotel in Madrid, I would definitely remember of this one.

Reviews.Title: “very good but not too sure about the 'ibis' look..”
Reviews.Author: tripper12345
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with attentive staff and nice coffee and the internet on a free computer available whenever required in the off lobby. Our room had been converted to an ibis style hotel room which has a brilliant feel to it. But I prefer the old fashion bright room with doors on wardrobes, drawers under side tables and a mini fridge to keep your drinks cold. After all Madrid in 40 degrees heat, that is when dry thirst kicks in and you reach for the fridge. The Hotel is in the centre of everything, a 15 minutes walk to Atocha Station, 10 minutes walk to Anton Martin. Puerta de Sol is not far away plus numerous other well known plazas and streets. The only other negative thing that we found is that for the excursions the hotel can arrange, they will not accept credit cards only cash which I found bizarre; maybe it is the state of the banks that are worrying many tour agencies?...

Reviews.Title: “Very good location in Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Hevadi
Reviews.Content: Kind Staff. Excellent Location in the middle of the city, close to the Prado Museum and other nice things to do. Metro in walking distance. Puerta del Sol in walking distance as well as Gran Via and the mercado de San Miguel. Good and comfortable rooms. Breakfast was "functional". Nespresso and other beverages available in the lobby

Reviews.Title: “A very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ramona C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. All this time we were really please by the services. Every day the room was cleaned and a special remark for the bathroom that was spotless. Also the breakfast could please anyone since you could choose from a variety of dishes and could take the breakfast until 11:30. This a very important detail if you want to sleep more. The staff was very helpful. All in all the hotel is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent considering upgrading work still in progress”
Reviews.Author: MikTheViking
Reviews.Content: The revamped and improved hotel is brilliantly situated close to the Prado and Thiessen-Bornemisza museums and the Spanish parliament. Around the corner in every direction are numerous cafes, tapas bars, restaurants and other delights. The rooms are large, yes large, by European city centre standards -- our bathroom alone was bigger than many a hotel bedroom I've been in. Spotlessly clean, and nicely designed throughout with bright (but not glaring) colour schemes and contemporary furniture, this is a place to return to for a friendly welcome and an efficient stay. Why efficient? Just because the cost of breakfast is already built-in. If you pre-pay (as we did) check-out is a doddle, just hand in your keycard and say "¡Hasta la vista!" on your way out. (The built-in buffet breakfast was great too!! How rare!) However, if you have a car, find a parking garage somewhere else, as the approaches to the hotel are narrow and public parking is in decidedly short supply (with fines being strictly and swiftly enforced). Taxis are abundant so getting around is not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wish they hadn't changed it!”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I've stayed at this hotel in the last 3 yrs. In the past i've found it to be a solid 3 stars, with a pleasant decor in the rooms , friendly service and good value. My family and I just stayed there this past week and I was very surprised that they have totally changed the decor in the rooms to what I would describe as a fake hip/ minimalist style. Gone are the closet doors and the nice beige and burgundy tones to be substituted to white and cool hues, together with a weird mural painted on the walls. Not attractive at all. In addition, the ac in the room they assigned us wasnt working properly, although they kept insisting it was working fine ( the other room we had was ok).the breakfast room has been improved. Its now in the basement but its bigger and brighter than the one they have before. Prices this year were higher but still reasonable. I was kept awake one night by people coming out of a bar about 3 am and staying in the street talking loudly. Another night the couple in the room next to ours decided to have a fight and the woman kept crying. Sound insulation is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tootsOH
Reviews.Content: We found the All Seasons Prado very nice. The rooms were clean and tasteful. The bathroom was rather large, especially for European standards, and water pressure was fine. The service at the front desk was great...they were able to answer all of our questions quickly and accurately. They have English speaking staff, so that made communication much easier for us. The included breakfast was plentiful and good, not great. We were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go, museums, restaurants, shopping. My only complaint was the pillows were long, tubular, and thick. I did not like them, and my neck was sore when I woke up. My husband, who usually uses two pillows, had no problem with them.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Ajit P
Reviews.Content: We went to Madrid last year in August 2011, the staff was friendly and extremely helpful! We also found the location of the hotel was perfect, in reach of all main attractions. The bedrooms were also kept very clean and the air conditioning worked perfectly. The bathroom was very clean also and the toiletries were provided for us! The breakfast was lovely there were various things to eat which we were very pleased about! Alongside this the lobby had a computer which was free to use, this also came in handy. Overall we were a family of 5 and we had an amazing stay at the hotel. Still think it should be higher than 3*!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, superb breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RRRachana
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location and it was wonderfully quiet, which was a nice surprise given all the great restaurants and nightlife nearby. The shower was exceptional - cool design and plenty of water pressure. AC worked great. Tons of good food for breakfast including soy milk! Only note is no full length mirror.

Reviews.Title: “just renovated centraly location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small but cozy, is under restoration on a minimalist way very white, glass walls for bathroom, so if do u share a room with colleague no intimacy for shower or other affairs in the toilet. The only complain was when arrived whent to the room in a floor where the guys where working hard and noisy I ask for change the room, and front desk said will call me back, she will talk with the guys to be more quiet but u know if they are working they are working, so no call back and of course no call from desk with solution...so I went out of the room for a coffee till they finished...loooong time

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: Foster44
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent, recently refurbished with all new fixtures and fittings. 15 minutes from the airport (about €30 in a taxi). Top location, 10 min walk to museums, bars and restaurants 2 mins away in lovely plaza's. Shops are a 5 minute walk away. Fantastic room (103) with seperate lounge area, large bathroom with seperate shower and jacuzzi bath, even an exercise bike in the room! Wifi available in the room (access intermittant). Good continental breakfast in refurbished breakfast room. Helpful staff, can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “A cheaper option in the city centre”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the Accorhotels website, the process was easy. I got a single room for 69 euros, which was the cheapest rate available (choosing a non flexible stay gave a 10% discount). For this price, the hotel was good value, the location is very central, the room was renovated recently and very clean. There was a hairdryer and some free amenities (toothpaste, shaving kit, shampoo, shower cap, etc). The buffet breakfast was included and there was a good choice. I give only a 4/5 because the room had no view through the window and was quite tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: akmbangalore
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location. 5 minutes walk from the metro. 5 minutes by walk from the historic center. 10 to 15 minutes by walk to the museums. Lots of eating places and supermarkets around. Safe area. Compact hotel, but with good sized rooms. Neatly done up toilet. Comfortable rooms. Good breakfast. Free wi-fi was well accessed in the room. Complimentary coffee-tea at the lounge next to the reception.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel offering much”
Reviews.Author: tango9111
Reviews.Content: Location. Central Madrid is small enough to argue that there are no bad locattions between the Prado at one end and the Palace at the other. However the museums, Retiro Park, and botanic garden are all on the east end and this hotel is only a short walk from all. The Hotel is also only five to ten minute walk or 4E taxi ride to the Yellow Bus stop which provides an express bus to the airport every 15 minutes for only 5E. Price. In Madrid, as many cities, prices go up and down depending upon the season and events being held. When I was in Madrid the price was 99E for a single and 109E for a double. The other Hotels in the immediate vicinity were a step up but started at 140e for a single and increased rapidly to over 300E. Relatively speaking the Prado was very good deal for this neighborhood. Ambience: The hotel is unabashedly modern European. Shiny white, off set by prime colors, chrome and grey. All very clean and neat. So if you want old Spain or old world atmosphere, look elsewhere. I like Euro modern and this is done well. Room. The room was ample with two side by side singles and plenty of room for luggage and to move around. The was a large flat screen tv. Good size desk and very large bathroom. There was no tub, but the shower was huge with plently of hot water. Hair dryer. The amenities were plentiful with comb, sewing kit, toothbrush and paste, shoe shine, shower cap, razor, soap and shampoo. The towels were thick. Public rooms: The reservation area is small but the hotel offers a good sized, comfortable reading and computer room with tea. The breakfast room is open only for breakfast but is large, bright and pleasant. . WIFI: In Europe most of the hotels will tell you they have WIFI in the rooms but even in many of the best hotels, the WIFI is spotty or doesn't work in the rooms because of the thickness of the old walls. None of them admit to this even when directly asked but it's common a problem. This hotel's Wifi was fast and always worked. Breakfast: The continental breakfast had many offerings of beverages, fruit, yogurt, cold cuts, cerials, and pastries. It was more than adequate: Summary: For over 125-150E, I would have given this hotel 4. stars. For the price, it gets five stars. For travelers who want more luxury try The Hotel Villa Real where singles start at about 14OE. Other neigboring hotels at its level started well over 200E. I didn't see the rooms but the public areas and desk service were top rate. For something cheaper try the Hostal Lapepa.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with perfect location !”
Reviews.Author: Karolien N
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in a 3-person bedroom. Room was very nice, clean and modern. The bathroom was new and very spacious with a nice walk-in-shower and toiletries. The hotel offers free wifi and there's a computer in the library that you can use. The 2 best things about this hotel: the location and the breakfast (which was included in the price). Location is very central, and in a nice neigbourhood. All the important museums as well as Puerta del Sol, Gran Via and Plaza Mayor are within short walking distance. The streets around the hotel are packed with some great restaurants and tapasbars. The hotel is very easy to reach, there's a metrostop at 300 metres (Anton Martin). The breakfastbuffet was amazing, a big selection of fresh fruits, cheese, charcuterie, bread, toast, pastries,...we loved it ! It was also maintained well and constantly supplied when something was out. There is only one (minor) downside which is the fact that the rooms are quite noisy, we could hear our neighbours talking quite loud in the evening / night (but I guess most hotels have this issue so it didn't bother us that much). Overall i would definitely recommend this hotel, with a price-quality ratio that is unbeatable !

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location, but...”
Reviews.Author: robert2533
Reviews.Content: Although the staff is still great and the location in Las Letras one of the best, the recent tie-in with Accord Hotels is disappointing. The All Seasons brand has taken what was once a nice, comfortable, traditional 3-star hotel and made it less appealing. The newly renovated rooms seem cold and uninviting, like staying in a cube or pod room. The mini-bar is a thing of the past. The closets have been removed from the renovated rooms, replaced with a while metal modular unit hung from the wall with a bar to hang your clothes. The new double platform beds are small (to make the room seem larger ?) and uncomfortable. And if you're even close to 6'0" tall, you'll find the bed doesn't quite fit. The renovated bathrooms are probably the best change. The bidets have been removed, as have the tubs, leaving the bathroom a little larger than before. All of the bathrooms now have walk-in showers, but they lack anyplace to hang a towel before or after taking a shower. The breakfast options have also changed. And although breakfast is included in the price of the room, you’ll find that there are far better options within a 10-minute walk of the hotel. It’s still a good hotel for those on a budget and don’t expect any creature comforts, but if this is the future of Accord Hotels in Spain, then I hate to see what they plan for the other properties they have on their wish list.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen P
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three days while recovering from jet lag. The staff could not have been more friendly or more patient. The room was spacious, clean, and well equipped. Breakfast was plentiful and well maintained. Much to my delight the hotel was located in the heart of the historic section within walking distance to wonderful plazas, historical locations, and museums. I felt very safe walking around this beautiful area of town solo, even in the early morning, Stayed on two separate occasions on this trip. It appeared the second floor room had been remodeled, much more modern looking. However, even the unremodeled room on the top floor was very well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with free wifi and nice breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Travelling with my son to get a taste of Spanish culture, the hotel suited us fine. Our criteria were all met: clean, quiet, free wifi, big continental breakfast, walking distance to main attractions and near the metro. I have stayed at a 5 star boutique hotel round the corner with my wife. The All Seasons doesn't have the wow factor, the glamour or the expensive bar bills but its a fraction of the price without too much compromise on what's important.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Madrid”
Reviews.Author: sandgrown_9
Reviews.Content: An excellent good value hotel with inclusive breakfast and internet. It has an excellent location central to all the key sites and restaurants. Still undergoing the final stages of restoration but did not inconvenience us the modern light and spacious rooms could not be faulted.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the single rooms”
Reviews.Author: NFinn_12
Reviews.Content: Great location, but the single rooms have windows that open on to an internal stairwell that also serves as the cleaners' cupboard. I couldn't open the window as it was not secure, someone could have climbed in to the room from the stairway. As a result the room has no fresh air and no natural light. Despite what the website said, the single rooms are not connected to the air conditioning, so after showering and using the hairdryer, the room was humid and unpleasant with no way of ventilating it.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean rooms and delicious breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: dizziest1
Reviews.Content: Part of the Accor chain. This clean, non-smoking hotel had a modern decor and great water pressure in the shower. We appreciated the working windows as it was necessary to open them to cool down the room (#402)and drown out the sounds from our noisy neighbors. There was good sound insulation from street noise but poor sound insulation between rooms. Free wi-fi. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet which is included with ALL the rooms- there was a good selection of fresh fruit (honeydew,kiwi,oranges,apples, tomatoes) and 5 different fresh pastries /croissants, tortilla de patata, espresso machine, 3 kinds of juice, yogurts, cereals. The breakfast attendants worked hard to keep the buffet stocked with fresh food. The price for this hotel was very reasonable, well worth the money spent.. There seems to be different sized rooms, ours was supposed to be a triple, but I think we ended up getting a double with a roll-away which was still a good size. Note we saw a single room that was very tiny. The hotel is in the middle of renovations so we had to use the service elevator which wasn't pretty, but still acceptable. The staff was wonderful, I appreciated that they let us check in early (9am) after our long flight.

Reviews.Title: “Winter stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: carrieflorida
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early in January with our two teenagers. As others have said it was ideally located. Far enough away from the touristy area of Plaza del Sol. In a convenient area close to decent restaurants, and near the high end hotels of the city. We had to take two rooms which were well priced, they were roomy and clean, it came with free breakfast which was nice and plentiful. After having travelled for two weeks in Spain we came to appreciate being on a high floor, although this area was quiet. Most hotels I discovered don't honor the request of a high floor and this one did so I appreciated that. I also found the front desk here to be very helpful and nice. Very convenient to the museums and walkable to other areas of the city. Overall a good European three star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 3 Star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bootsyNorthWales
Reviews.Content: This hotel is idealy situated if you want to walk around Madrid,So many restaurants and bars are really close by and so are the shops.Cheap way to get to the city centre from the airport is to get the yellow bus from the airport it only costs 2 Euro and takes about 20 minutes depending on where you get off.For the price we paid for 3 nights for 2 people which was £214 it offers great value for money,The rooms were clean and tidy and the towels were changed every day also we went at the end of December and the room was really warm which pleased my wife .

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in good location”
Reviews.Author: Rach5000
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here. Excellent location and very quiet rooms. Breakfast included, standard but very adequate and nice. Wifi annoying though, as kept logging you out at short erratic time intervals. Otherwise nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place, nice room”
Reviews.Author: LuGodri
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been refurbished recently. So, instead the hall being a little bit old, the rooms are great. The floor is by wood, the bed is good, there is a frigobar. The breakfast is nice, the employees too. I am very happy about being there. And let me tell: the place is AWESOME! You can visit almost all city by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location --- within walking distance to museums, art galleries, theaters, Plaza Mayor, Plaza Santa Ana, Sol, Gran Via, shopping ... and hundreds of restaurants and cafes. Very friendly staff and good service-- I received several messages and all were taken down accurately and delivered promptly. Great to have computer in lobby area in addition to Wifi in rooms. Note: if solo traveler, do not ask for single room, ask for double room for one.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Room and Bathroom were very nice and well accommodating. Location was close to city center and a number of Tapas Bars and Restaurants. Well accessible from all streets. Would recommend for short stays in Madrid as hotel only offers bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, well located, good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Travelator2
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in early November 2011. Well managed hotel with good modern rooms. Inclusive buffet breakfast excellent value. Whilst the street is not particularly busy, there is a steady passage of cars and garrulous groups of pedestrians on the way to local cafes, and the canyon like street does seem to amplify the noise. We found soundproofing was good with the windows shut, but with the windows open it was quite noisy. But this wasn’t a major issue, and I suspect would be the same for any town centre hotel. Very well located for all the major sights: my only regret was buying a 3 day metro-bus card, which we hardly needed to use because everything is within walking distance. To get here from the airport, I recommend Metro line 8 to Colombia, line 9 to Principe de Vergara, line 2 to Banco de Espana, then 10 minute walk. Also, do a day trip to Toledo, 30 mins on on the high speed train from Atocha station.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, convenient location but a little noisy.”
Reviews.Author: eteo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 2 separate periods of 3 nights each. It was more than adequate and reasonably priced. During the second period of our stay we found it a little noisy because of street noise. Not sure why because the windows are double glazed. Yet the noise still came into our rooms. In any case, we enjoyed our stay and could walk to most places. The reception are extremely helpful and can print out your boarding passes for you when you check in online.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: vinnyc2011
Reviews.Content: we drove from the airport and had a difficult time finding the hotel, the locals kept directing us to the main street the paseo di prado so we spent two hours going in circles so it was a little difficult to find off on a side street however the staff was exceptional and the breakfast service superb. as stated it is within walking distance to the prado and the plaza mayor. my only complaint is the cost of overnight parking which was 25 euros or 37 dollars us, which I think they should mention in their descriptions. I thought this was very expensive but there were no other parking alternatives, my only other suggestion would be not to drive to the location and take a cab. again other than that the hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Welcome Haven!”
Reviews.Author: scalette
Reviews.Content: We had passed by this hotel many times over the years and although the location is good, it always appeared a little shabby from the outside. When we noticed that it had become an All Seasons hotel we decided to try it as we had a very enjoyable stay in the A/S Chateau Landon in Paris. This was to be our last stop before returning home and we wanted to take things slowly in Madrid . This hotel was all we wanted. It is not fancy but is comfortable, we had a large room with everything we needed and the standard of cleanliness was very high. What impressed us most was how little ambient noise there was. The rooms seem to be arranged so that the bathrooms alternate with bedrooms so noise is reduced. It was very useful having breakfast provided as was the free use of the computer (and help yourself to hot drinks!).. The staff were friendly and most helpful. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to discover this hotel in the centre of Madrid. It is not expensive for the value it gives and you will find yourself in the centre of the cultural life of the capital of Spain. The Prado museum is not far and many art galeries, small restaurants, shops, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Short break”
Reviews.Author: MacLaugh
Reviews.Content: We found this Hotel excellent. Very central for everything. Rather noisy outside the first night and reception were very helpful and moved us to another quiter room.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: anncoates
Reviews.Content: Just back from Madrid where I spent four nights at the All Seasons. Not only is the location great - close to all the main attractions including the Prado Museum, Plaza el Sol etc - but the room we stayed in was exceptionally clean. The beds were really comfortable and a special mention for the very cushy pillows. Breakfast was included and there was great choice in the buffet which set you up for the day. The staff were so friendly and helpful. On the first night, teenagers in the room next to us were making noise. Reception sorted the matter out immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay!”
Reviews.Author: tripper12345
Reviews.Content: On our stay in Madrid summer 2011 we came across this hotel. A deceptively well appointed establishment. The reception staff were helpful and nice. The rooms were lovely. With air conditioning which is a must in August. The breakfast was plentiful. There was free internet use. ...and free coffee. In a central location in quaint little streets. The nearest Metro was Anton Martin which is not far. Great little Hotel and a shiny jewel in their crown. Accor d'accord!

Reviews.Title: “All Seasons is a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was clean. The Bathroom was nice and the shower is very good. The Breakfast was very good. The location is nice and near by the public transportations. Only the noisy street , we couldn’t sleep early especially the wither was good and we slept with the opened window. The front office employees were nice and helpful, specially a girl named: Natalyia

Reviews.Title: “General views”
Reviews.Author: alant3898
Reviews.Content: Following a recent visit to this hotel we were placed in a room on the second floor. The room was quite spacious and clean but had no natural light due to the window overlooking an encased external fire escape. This is the only reason I didn't give it full rating. The Continental breakfast was reasonable and the downstairs lounge had free internet and beverage facilities. Not having visited Madrid before, the assistance and patience of a busy receptionist (Silvia) was exceptional and greatly appreciated. The hotel itself is Central and convenient for all services and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Troublesome air-conditioning. Small bed. Excellent breakfast. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: goyourownway
Reviews.Content: N40°24'53.81", E3°41'56.13" Near metro station Anton Martin, this is a well-situated hotel between the Prado Museum and Plaza de Santa Ana. Inside there’s a wine theme running throughout the hotel, which itself is a combination of several buildings. Room 206 in March of 2011 was spacious, except the bed. This bed was really small for two persons sleeping. The temperature in the room was very high and we failed to turn the heating off, although the room had a thermostat. Eventually we couldn’t sleep and opened a double-glazed window. The noise from the Calle el Prado was overwhelming and although the temperature dropped we couldn’t sleep because of noise. The fan offered by the reception was no solution. After a troublesome night we were pleasantly surprised by the truly excellent breakfast in the basement. This lifted up our spirits.

Reviews.Title: “Best location you can think of”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, great great value for money. Highly recommend this hotel. Friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is right in the middle of the way between old madrid and the newer part, so you couldn't ask for a better location. We walked most of the time and took the metro only on a few occasions to distant locations.

Reviews.Title: “I would like to repeat the experience”
Reviews.Author: Daniel R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, in the city center, but in a quiet street. The staff is polite and helpful. There are functional maps of the city and all kinds of discount cards. My room (507) was spacious and very clean with double windows, that's right: Two overlapping windows, keeping it very quiet. The shower had good pressure. The box though wide, has no door, which wet the floor a bit and I missedmore places to hang the towels. the bathroom door is of glass like etched.,but there is another door betwen it and the room. The hair dryer is powerful. The cabinet is spacious and has a safe. Everything in the hotel is new, as I show in the photos. the Kit includes soft toothbrush, toothpaste with fluoride and even sewing needle and thread (which proved useful when a button came off my clothes). I ordered a double bed but got twin beds, which seems to be common from what I've seen in my travel in Europe. For those who like to bring snacks for the room, like me, the mini bar is relatively spacious compared to others I've seen. there is a coffee machine (with variety) and drinks machine (cheaper than the minibar in room) in the lobby. The teas, water from the drinker and the wifi are free. Hotel also has a room with books, computer with internet. Except for this room (with stairs) , the whole hotel seemed ready to receive disabled. The breakfast is varied and fresh products are, unfortunately forgot to take pictures. as I booked online, I had no surprises, was not asked any signal or card at check-in. And at check out I had just to undersign the debit card authorization.

Reviews.Title: “All Seasons Madrid Prado - Accor hotel, in a good position for walking to some of the famous sights in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay in an "All seasons" hotel. We arrived by train to Atocha railway station which is not too far from the hotel. As we had luggage we took a taxi and the driver couldn't find Calle de Prado - he had to ask at a taxi rank! The hotel is very well positioned and with in easy walking distance of such things as the Prado Museum, the Thyssen-Bournemisza Museum and the Botanical garden. The streets around the museum are narrow and people sized with lots of small squares and interesting bars and restaurants. The only disappointment was our bedroom. It had windows but they opened onto the fire escape - it felt like we were in a cave! But having said that it was spacious enough with a good sized shower room. It was spotlessly clean. The staff said that we could change rooms but as we were only staying overnight we decided not to. We will definitely use this hotel again as it is a perfect place for seeing many of the sights. The breakfast was very good and there is coffee available in reception for 1.50 Euros. The staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Puppiespaws
Reviews.Content: This hotel is deceiving, from the outside and reception area one wouldn't think much of it, but the rooms are awesome!! Our room was huge and so was the bathroom, which I believe is pretty standard for this hotel. Very clean and such a nice feel, we immediately loved our room. Definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Budget getaway”
Reviews.Author: Clerkenwell
Reviews.Content: We made this trip to Madrid on the cheap. We flew on a budget airline, stuck to public transport and found this newly labelled Accor hotel. I would compare the standard to that of an Ibis. It doesn't have the same pre-fab feel of most Accor hotels. At the some time, some element did feel a little dated. I think, however, it will continue to improve as the Accor identity becomes more noticeable. Location - Very central: 5 minute walk from at least 2 metro stations. It is also on a bustling, semi-pedestrianised Tapas Bar laden street. This is perfect for a quick getaway. There are a number of high quality restaurants nearby suiting all tastes. Being on Calle el Prado would suggest that it is close to that particular museum. It's a 10 minute walk. The main shopping area is also 10 minutes away. The room – Small: In fact my mother-in-law wasn't happy with her internal facing single room. But again, it is what you would expect from a budget hotel. Our double was more generous. The TV and wifi worked (and was free). It was tidy and forgettable. The breakfast - this was relatively simple fare. Also, this was unremarkable but provided us with enough to get us to lunch. Conclusion - As I mentioned above, this is a very centrally located budget hotel in a major European capital city. I think I paid EU80 for a double. You can't really expect any more for that value.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice remodelled room & bathroom. Very quiet except for the noise of party goers in the street (happened twice), but the room was almost sound-proof. Good breakfast, very helpful and friendly staff and top location. Overall a very good place to stay. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel. My hotel in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: mi_coelho
Reviews.Content: I went to All Seasons Madrid Prado for 3 nights and I'm very happy I chose this hotel. First: LOCATION! Located in the Calle del Prado you can reach all Madrid's main attractions by foot, saving almost 15€ in public transportations. The hotel is also easily reached from the airport sice the bus stop of Plaza Cibelle is 3 min walk from the hotel. Museo del Prado, Parque del Retiro, Puerta del Sol,Gran Via etc are all 2/3 min away from the hotel. Its location is in a busy street with small bars and restaurants so eating in the vicinity and live a bit of the Madrid night is very easy and not very expensive. THE HOTEL is very nice, the rooms are spacious, the bathroom is very large. The aminities are different form what you're used to but good. It has mini-bar and a safe deposit box in the room. The beds are alrge and cosy, I just thought the pillows were very high but that's personal opinion. You can choose from 2 types of pillows so no problem. I went with a friend of mine and since we were both women they gave us an offer kit and a note book, which was very nice! The breakfast and Wi-Fi is included in the price and if you do not take a computer you can use the one in the common area. The breakfast has a lot of choice although it is not continental. It has a large variety of fruits, break, cheeses, cakes and regional offer but no scrumble eggs or things of that sort. The staff is extremelly nice and helpfull. The only thing you can notice is some street noise but I was so tiered from tourism activities that I slept like a baby! On my return to Madrid I will go to this hotel, no doubt about it!

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel in a fine elegant city”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived by overnight train from lisbon and so checked in early at about 10.00am not expecting our room to be ready but it was. So from the very start the staff were friendly and helpful. This little gem of a Hotel has an excellent location in the heart of the old City only minutes walk from the Prado musuem, Plaza del Mayo and many restaurants etc. We had a front room but no noise from the street because of soundproofing although we could open the window which is a relief if you dont want the aircon on all the time. Good size room and a great bathroom and comfy bed. The breakfast was good even scrambled eggs and bacon etc. which you dont expect in a European City Hotel. Very good value Hotel which we could not fault . We are a couple in our late sixties from BRISBANE AUSTRALIA

Reviews.Title: “very small room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: very small single room given the price of it with lots of noise from corridor and a windows view on the fire escape stairs breakfast was nice and till late ( 11.30 am) no information in the room regarding smoking policy but the staff was really friendly

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice room with balcony, staff friendly, good location, excellent buffet breakfast. We enjoyed our stay at this very clean and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: arnoldnead
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after 10 nights in various Paradors. Quite a contrast! Parador breakfasts had fresh squeezed real orange juice, fresh perked coffee, snowy white tablecloths, eggs fresh cooked anyway to order. El Prado had machine coffee, el cheapo supemarket OJ, no eggs anyway and school canteentype tables. But it was half the price of a Parador, you do get what you pay for. Having said that El Prado has great merit for the price; clean, central location, free wi-fi, free coffee & water in reception, adequate breakfast, reasonably comfortable and our room (topmost floor) was very quiet. Recommended at the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: albarn3
Reviews.Content: Being an American who travels all over Europe, this hotel was very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They offered free internet in the lobby and free wi-fi, which is hard to come by. The hotel was very clean, as were the individual rooms. Due to being solo, I was staying in an interior room. It was small (normal with European hotels), but adequate space for what I needed. The bathroom was surprisingly large. My only complaint with this hotel was that my room was very warm (room 409). I had a window that opened up to stairs for an indoor fire escape. I had to leave that window open at night to cool the room enough to sleep. My friends were staying in a double room with a balcony, which was very nice. The breakfast was very good and offered a decent selection. I would definitely say here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location cannot be beat, but noisy even in interior room”
Reviews.Author: nycgal12345
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of the location - which is fabulous - close to all the museums, and sights. We got placed in Room 702, which the elevator did not reach. Floor 7 only had two rooms, and our room had a small terrace area with no view. We had to walk one flight of stairs since the elevator stopped on the sixth floor. In the morning though, there is a lot of noise (banging noise) and we don't know where it comes from but we keep hearing these sudden, 2 seconds "BANG" constantly. Also the housekeeper came into our room one time when we were inside and she slammed the door when she heard us. I'd only stay there for its location and its price, but I am sure there are plenty of hotels around the area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: jniceday
Reviews.Content: Stay away from this place! The room was tiny, dark--no overhead lights, and the bedside lamps were so low they gave almost no light. There was plenty of noise at night, also works at the hotel and nobody told us when we made the reservation, so after enduring a day of shock, we decided to change hotel. A disaster, will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, and great value!”
Reviews.Author: momofour61
Reviews.Content: For the price, I couldn't believe what a great location this was AND how large the room was. The location is perfect. Madrid really is a good walking city. The hotel is centrally located and we were able to walk everywhere - we even walked back from the Teleferico in Casa de Campos, a good hike but all through great neighborhoods. I've found in major European cities that the rooms and the bathrooms can be tiny. This was not the case. I was traveling with my 16-year-old son. The room was big enough to feel like we could hang out for a while (we requested a high exterior room), and the bathroom was a very good size, too. We had no problem with street noise at night. The hotel gave us a ticket for a 2-for-1 at the breakfast buffet, which was a great deal. It'sa decent breakfast. The staff was helpful enough and gave us a wakeup call on time to go to the airport. No other problems with the room. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “loved the hotel el parado, couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: charley48
Reviews.Content: when we got off the metro ,and strolled down Calle de LEon, just as they said, there is the hotel. We had a fabulous room on the 6th floor, with a terrace. I was a bit worried, because i am the lightest sleeper in the world. The Hotel el Prado has this down right, double paned windows. Absolutly no noise at all. The rooms were bright and cheery, with material of grapes on the chairs. The beds were oh, so comfy, with lots of pillows. The bathroom was deluxe. The breakfast came with the over 60 pkg. and was one of the best on our month long trip. The bakery products (about 10 different), were fresh and yummy. There was a selection of fruit, juices , meats, eggs, just about anything you could want. And the cool espresso machine, that made 6 different drinks, with hot milk ect. loved that.The hotel is centrally located and easy walking thru the city. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and ordered us a shuttle for the airport. I would stay here again, and certainly recommend this to anyone wanting a clean, well located, wonderful staffed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exactely what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: conradonunes
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect! The hotel is very nice located and the room more than enough for me. I defenitelly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, bad rooms”
Reviews.Author: LondonKarina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel as a single traveller, chosen for it's location and wifi. The room on the sixth floor was miniscule, the bathroom even more so. Window with frosted glass looked out on to a fire escape. The minibar fridge didn't work. The wi fi didn't work (reception told me it doesn't work with Macs), though there are two computers that can be used in reception but without any privacy. The air conditioning didn't work. Was woken every morning at 8am by chamber maids speaking loudly outside the room and wheeling trollies around. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Clive4905
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Prado six or seven times over the past 15 years and it's become the only hotel that I immediately think of. Apart from being good value, very central and in a highly convenient location, it offers very comfortable accommodation and service. I would not hesitate to recommend it and look forward very much to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in central area!”
Reviews.Author: kebabkongen
Reviews.Content: I was going to Madrid for a business conference (2 days). Got a good deal off the hotel's own website (€ 133 in total for two nights!). In addition, I got one of the top floor rooms (which I had informally asked for), both of which have its own (small) terrace. I was not expecting much from the hotel, since the price was so good. But the room I got was really nice, and the hotel was central (although in a backstreet). Very close to Plaza St Ana, Sol etc. I would book here again if I could get a similar deal - even with a slightly higher price.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for the weekend - Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: heartbeat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for long weekend. Check in was delayed by hour and for a short visit was a little frustrating. Room was on 7th floor with little balcony facing roof tops- with a little table and strangely one chair. View was a roof top but on quiet side of hotel. Room itself was great and plenty of space in wardrobe and free safe was welcome too. Had mini bar, tv, and bathroom was nice too with normal items. There is no team or coffee making facilities which would have been welcome after a long day walking - although a coffee machine was downstairs by reception. Reception team were very polite and helpful and provided map and tips. You can buy the red bus tickets here also - just over 17 euro each. Bus stops about 5 -10 mins away (turn left out of hotel). In reception area there were 2 computers with free internet. Wifi was free also. There is a cold drinks machine in reception too. Breakfast was 9 euro for buffet. Nice and airy room. Food mostly continental style (ie dont expect bacon and eggs other than scrambled). A sweet little 2 slice toaster which is inadequate for everyone. Service was a bit poor (had to ask for cereal bowl, then for cups, then for spoons - but maybe they were having off day). We came away feeling 9 euro was steep but we werent hungry. Location of hotel very good on Calle del Prado in a narrow street leading to several plazas (with plenty of places to eat and drink, especially tapas). Turn right out of hotel and 2 mins you are at one square,keep walking and you get to Plaza Mayor within 10 mins - and all its array of buildings, eating and drinking places both inside the square and outside of it. You must visit the Mercado De San Miguel near Playa Mayor - it has many stalls selling all sorts of produce for you to try with some wine, some cheese, meats etc. Such a buzz about the place. We took the red bus trip (the historical tour) and that takes about 75min. Red bus is almost always a good way to get and see the sites. The area around the hotel is alive at night and the squares nearby are a magnet for people. When off to bed near midnight (sad) its still very active. Road by hotel is busy (its only a car width) hence getting a room away from the front may be a good idea. Theres so much to see in Madrid a weekend cant be anywhere near enough time but a good taster. For sure you will have tired feet, will try many tapas and have plenty of short stops for a beer or wine. Area is of course predominantly Spanish but most areas were welcoming. Try the small bars on route to Plaza Major. Taxis from airport by the way was fine - always take the licensed taxis (red stripe on them) from airport it was 30 euro (note that they add euros onto the meter price - for airport). Return was more for some reason (almost 40 euro but 5.50 was for airport). Expensive so metro is still a good alternative - see other reports. Few words of advice - Madrid airport is enormous. You WILL need all of the two hours to get from entrance to the gate on way home - which also includes a train ride, several checks of passports and security etc. It is vast but well organised. We arrived at airport at 10.40am and we got to the gate at 12.15 - and we didnt hang about.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ScottishSheila
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights earlier this month and thoroughly enjoyed it. The staff on reception were great - from helping to have a hairdryer replaced to laughing with a slightly tipsy Scotswoman celebrating her birthday! This was our 2nd visit to Madrid and the hotel proved to be a great choice - room 602 ( with balcony) had lots of room, nice bathroom etc, great choice for breakfast. The free internet was useful too. We were able to get a good quiet night's sleep but were still in the middle of all the attractions, squares, bars etc. If you are used to walking the dog a lot then you hardly need the metro / buses to get around. Approx. 10 minutes to Prado, 15 to Atocha, 5 to Sol, 10 to Plaza Mayor etc. etc Everyone frets about getting to and from the airport ! I'd done my worried research! We flew into Terminal 1, took the well signposted walkway to the Metro ( its on Youtube), 2 Euros to Nuevos MInisterios - ticket booth available if automated machines are scary. If you don't want to have to change metro lines: followed signs for Cercanias: these are local commuter trains. We paid around 1.50 Euros to Sol which takes 4 minutes. Again, easy touchscreen machines with instructions you can see in English. Escalators and lifts in stations and then its an easy downhill walk from there to the hotel. We timed it on the return journey and it was 55 minutes from hotel door to the Terminal! For less than 10 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: dotan_haifa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Prado hotel for 5 nights. It was great. There is wifi in the rooms, the breakfast is very rich, the guys in the hotel are friendly and very helpful. I would recommend this hotel also to my friends. It is relatively quiet (we were at the 4th floor). The problem is that the ventilation (when you sleep and close the window for quiet room) is only freezing and my wife suffered from the temprature. It is close to the main events in Madrid, and to the Metro. It is near plaza (forgot the name) for quick food and drink. We enjoyed it! Price 676 Euro for 5 nights (135 Euro for night) + breakfast for 2 adults+child!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: McSammo
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - right near Santa Ana with lots of lovely places to eat, within walking distance of major attractions, near a Metro stop. Lovely hotel, great breakfast and when we had a travel mess-up the guy at the front desk could not have been more helpful, calling round to find us another hotel at short notice for an unexpected extra night.

Reviews.Title: “Place for shopping traveller”
Reviews.Author: Burgsinn
Reviews.Content: Very well location hotel inside strolling expanse of the repository locality (Prado, Thyssen, Reina Sofia), Plaza Santa Ana and Plaza Mayor. Several Metro positions inside 10 minute walk. Stayed in luxury room with ensuite wash, which was well nominated and clean. Breakfast assortment was good. Wine topic intriguing where as did not actually glimpse the issue of it ! highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Once again, very good experience”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel, last one in March 2009. Once again, the hotel gave very good value for the money. I paid around 62 euros for a double for single use. Upon arrival they gave me a voucher to purchase breakfast at 50% off, less than 5 euros. For what they offered it was excellent value. Initially they assigned me a room that was a bit smaller than the ones we had the prior year, plus they faced Prado street (which I was afraid could be noisy). I asked if I could be given one of the rooms facing the side street and they said one would be available later in the morning. An hour later I was checked in in a more spacious room. Rooms are extremly clean, modern , and with good storage. Beds are comfortable. Bathroom is bright, with good water pressure and nice towels. A/C was great, and believe me, we needed it as temps were in the high 90s. The only negative was that eventhough my room faced a side street, it was still close enough to hear the revelers walking on Prado street late at night (or early in the morning) as they left Plaza Santa Ana. The windows must not be sound proof. Still, given the excellent value the hotel provides and its great location , I would stay here again. The front desk staff is very nice and helpful. They have a couple of computers available for guests to use.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Henk61
Reviews.Content: Very good (modernised) hotel in Madrid. The location is excellent if you want to visit the museums of El Prado, Reina Sofia and Thyssen Bornemisia, just a couple of blocks away. Many attractive restaurants in the neighbourhood (Plaza St. Anna and Calle Huertas). A short walk to the Metro station. We had a big room on the top floor. Friendly staff, they speak good English. Internet available, also on 2 workstations.

Reviews.Title: “Functional choice: Great location, adequate rooms”
Reviews.Author: cortney
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in two different rooms in the Hotel El Prado. (We visited Madrid for 2 days, then went to Majorca, and then returned for one more night.) We chose this hotel based on location and price: it was in a superb location (just a few blocks from Sol) and affordably priced. Overall, the rooms are clean and adequate; definitely not luxurious. The air conditioning never quite cooled either of our rooms as much as we'd like, and the first room was uncomfortably warm. This might just be par for traveling to Madrid on a week of 90-100 degree F temps. The front desk staff was helpful; we mostly asked them for directions to our next site or restaurant. Our first room was on the 7th floor, which requires you to walk a flight of stairs because the elevator stops at the 6th floor. They said they only use these rooms when all others are booked, and this was our warmest room. It was also a cramped room with an awkward floorplan. Our second room was equally cramped, but elevator-accessible. (On this visit, they initially gave us a room with a broken AC, but immediately switched us.) Breakfast was very convenient. Tons of options on a buffet. As an American, during my entire weeklong stay in Spain I got nostalgic for some classics from home (like french toast and pancakes), but they had scrambled eggs, spanish tortilla, yogurt, and pastries (croissants, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “amazing location, extremely central”
Reviews.Author: kreyes12
Reviews.Content: This hotel was close to so many different areas in Madrid. In 1-2 minutes, you were in Plaza de Santa Ana, which was almost always full of people until about 2 AM. (Note: We did not hear any noise from the streets). In 5-10 minutes, you were in Puerta del Sol, great shopping and full of activity. We walked pretty much everywhere and never felt so exhausted! The room itself was pretty big. The bathroom was also large. Beds were comfortable! There was a safe in the room and it was always cleaned well! The hotel staff were very friendly and informative. The price was great, about 95 euros a night!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our weekend city break”
Reviews.Author: Iantom
Reviews.Content: Yes this Hotel was perfect little find for our mini break traveling with my wife and nine year old son it was in a great loction with a metro station within a two minute walk away also Plenty of shops, bars and museums within walking distance. Would definitely use this Hotel if we travel to Madrid again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to explore Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Karen079
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect to reach all four winds of Madrid on foot. Personally I preferred to roam around the beautiful streets of Madrid on foot but the metro system is new, clean and looks efficient for who doesn' t want to walk. You will loose a lot of the magnificent buildings they have though if you choose the metro but it's up to your likings after all. Back to the hotel cleanliness is of high quality. everyday rooms are cleaned very well and supplied with fresh towels. The rooms are spacious with new furniture and the ensuite is also big and with both a bath and shower incorporated. The only drawback is that if you use the showergel and soap supplied by the hotel they will not be replaced and you will be left with none, so take supplies with you. The breakfast was very good and had a large selection to choose from like cereals, bread, cold cuts, jams, tortilla and for those with a sweet tooth there' s a large selection of sweet pastries too. Obviously coffee, tea, juices and water are available too. In a few words it' s a welcoming buffet breakfast to start a good day with. Next to the reception there is also two computers with free internet and you don' t need any number or permission from the reception to use it. It' s free to use at any time. The staff is very nice too. The female receptionists are sweet and helpful. They are always there to help you with whatever you need. I didn' t like the male receptionist a lot though, he has a cold approach and doesn' t sound really helpful in the way he express himself. As a global rating to anyone I would certainly recommend this hotel and if I had to visit Madrid again this would be the place I will stay once again. The only thing that made me start my holiday on the wrong foot is that I arrived at 6 in the morning after a night awake due to travelling and when I presented my passports at the reception, the male receptionist just made a face as if he couldn' t care less, shrugged his shoulders and told me that they were fully booked! I thought I had made a mistake in booking but the problem was that the rooms were all full until a visitor leaves and the cleaner comes to clean that empty room for us to move in. Personally I felt offended as it was not a pleasant way to welcome us but I just wanted to warn you about this circumstance cause we didn' t get a room until 0930 in the morning. Apart from this I had a marvellous stay there and I would do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: seebear150
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is within walking distance of all the tourist sites. The desk staff is fluent in English and tolerated our attempts to speak Spanish. Our room was on the 6th floor and had small walk out balcony. The room was clean. The hotel staff was helpful with directions and recommendations. The breakfast is overpriced but is optional. The hotel is within walking distance of the Prado, Royal Palace, Plaza Major, Puerta del Sol, etc. We were there during the soccer finals. The room price went down to a quarter of the price once the soccer final was over. We recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: gdethe
Reviews.Content: As a solo occupant in a double room for 9 nights, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel. The room was clean and comfortable, the bathroom was well equipped, and the service was friendly and polite. Best of all, the hotel was ideally situated, close to the museums, the parks, the main train station and some great eating places. What I missed was an English news channel on TV, although the free internet allowed me to follow the course of the volcanic ash, which was a source of anxiety. The massive construction work going on in front of the hotel did not disturb.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lella24
Reviews.Content: Placed conviently in a central part of Madrid making it easy to either walk or take the metro to major sites. Nice staff - English speaking. Very clean large rooms. Ample varied b'fast and value for money.Only glitch was our airconditioning not working but receptionist on duty kindly arranged for us to have a fan within minutes! Would have liked to prolong our stay..will definitely be back if go again to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay in the single room”
Reviews.Author: K_Crockett
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hotel El Prado was excellent - short walk to major sights and museums. The staff was courteous. Breakfast was adequate. However, DO NOT be lured (like I was) by the relatively low price of the single room and DO NOT book it. It is an airless, tiny room with a small bed and without a real window. It should be illegal to put hotel guests in that room. It would do nicely as a storage closet, but it is just wrong to put paying hotel guests in that room. I'm sure the double rooms (which are normal hotel rooms) are nice. Had I stayed in one of those rooms, I'm sure I would have rated this hotel higher.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and friendly staff--need more staff at breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: lilyflorence
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for visiting galleries. Not a smart hotel but clean and comfortable and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly stay here again---3 stars plus!”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaDoll
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week in Madrid and enjoyed my stay at Hotel el Prado. The room was basic but immaculate; the beds and pillows were very comfortable; the water pressure and availability of hot water were outstanding. The buffet breakfast (normally 9 euros per person, but we got a 2 for 1 deal since we stayed so long) was more than satisfactory. The view wasn't great, and there was construction outside, but the location is good. We had room 601, which is near the elevator, and the noise was pretty irritating. I'd recommend getting a room which is "03" or higher (there are about 6 or 7 rooms on each floor) to avoid the elevator noise. The staff were friendly and helpful. Don't let my 3-star rating put you off; I never give any hotel a 5, and to get a 4 it has to knock my socks off. This place is a great find, and I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely comfortable hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: anniemike9
Reviews.Content: The hotel has great rooms. They are really well furnished and very comfortable and the whole hotel is absolutely spotless. Staff are friendly, efficient and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. Hotel is located in a great position for the Prado, the Reina Sofia and the Palacio Real - they are all within walking distance. Nearby are some good restaurants and cafes. Great hotel for a stay in Madrid. Would absolutly recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean rooms, lovely breakfast and not expensive”
Reviews.Author: SOUTHWELLIAN
Reviews.Content: The hotel was warm and welcoming with friendly staff. Although the lifts are small our rooms on the 4th and 5th floors were comfortable and clean. The Bathrooms were well serviced and adequate hot water allowed for hot baths. The venue is well placed for the Museums and Metro to get around and there are some good eateries close-by. The Breakfast selection is extensive and staff present ensure any questions or requests are met. The price paid for two people Bed and Breakfast we thought, was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: milliemoowirral
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Prado is a lovely hotel and the staff are very welcoming and helpful. The room we had was great, Cava, on the top floor with it's own small terrace and very comfortable. It is in a great location near to Plaza Santa Ana and Puerto del Sol. Another plus is it has a small carpark in the basement and the fees are reasonable for Madrid and free WiFi connection throughout the hotel. Next time I visit Madrid I will definately choose El Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Madrid city-break stop-over”
Reviews.Author: MikTheViking
Reviews.Content: This small wine-themed hotel is close to ALL the major cultural and historic sites of central Madrid. And it's next to fun barrios for wining/dining and crafts shopping. The hotel itself is quietly efficient and has all the amenities needed. Rooms are smallish but not cramped, and the bathrooms are beautifully designed both for use of space and function. Complimentary coffee is available in the lobby for those who miss it in their room. Try their special deals! ...Wine experience, ...Cultural walks, ...Discounted city breaks. My wife and I indulge in these on our three trips a year to Madrid and this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at Hotel El Prado”
Reviews.Author: Renejazz
Reviews.Content: I enjoy to travel with my wife and son (17 years old now) to have Xmas.and New Year's Eve at a different place, and we usually stay at big chain hotels. Well, we went to Madrid and decided to stay at Hotel El Prado from Dec.18th until January 2nd and I'm sure it was probably the best decision we made in our trip to Spain. If location,location is important, then this hotel is # 1. Extremely well located, really close to the main museums, Puerta del Sol, and all the important spots to visit. Also close to a Metro Station that in Madrid is excellent!. Needless to say that in the area there are more restaurants than the ones you could visit in case you stay 2 months in the hotel! Our room size was fine, not big (according to European standard) but comfortable and extremely clean. In fact we only used the room to sleep as during the day we were visiting places. Breakfast buffet is EXCELLENT and you won't find a similar one for the same price in Madrid. Service was really good and the most important thing is the staff which is very helpful and friendly. They arranged our tours in Madrid and the ones we had to cities as Toledo, Avila,etc. and also helped us with the tours we did by ourselves taking the train to cities close to Madrid. We spent two wonderful weeks there without any doubt. If you are not looking for a fancy hotel with a well known name, do not waste any time looking around and go to Hotel El Prado. I know you will be glad if you do it. We will do it for sure in our next trip to Spain this summer. Rene. Miami, FL. USA.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and secure”
Reviews.Author: TWBuddy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nicely furnished in standard style, with each room named for a wine region. On each floor there was a bowl of fruit and we really enjoyed our breakfast in the restaurant downstairs. It is located in a small street so there was no view, except of the other buildings but it was quiet because the windows were double glazed. Staff were really helpful in arranging the shuttle bus back to Madrid Airport for us. The WIFI wasn't working when we were there, although we were offered use of a free terminal in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: BoskaMarys
Reviews.Content: Just recently went to Madrid for a 2 days romantic trip with boyfriend and stayed in El Prado. Have to admit that location is superb giving you very short walking distance to all main sights. It is very easy to get there from the airport as well. Rooms are very small and basic, there is no tea and coffee facilities in the room at all, only reception staff speak a little bit English but very helpful and polite. Quite good breakfast! Quite noisy in the morning from the street outside. All of it it was fine but would say too pricey for a 3 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: modmini
Reviews.Content: First the two negatives: can be on noisy side due to hardwood/laminate floors and thinish walls and water in shower had tendency to do hot/cold bit when a toilet was flushed on another floor.. Otherwise exceedingly clean, well located, well run Hotel with spacious rooms and bathrooms and no street noise assuming window/sliding door is shut. Comfortable beds, excellent fast wireless in the room (where I'm currently writing this review) Haven't relied or interacted with hotel staff much but were friendly during check in and when coming and going

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Magic”
Reviews.Author: AussieJourneyman
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Prado bats above its 3 star average. Firstly the rooms - large, spacious extremely clean, large bathroom. Secondly the location - within walking distance to all the popular sites - Plaza Mayor, Museo El Prado, Museo Thyssien, the Metro, Palacio Real, Cava Baja, Jardin El Retiro, Gran Via, etc.... Thirdly the service - from our first introduction, the staff (noticeably all female) were only too eager to assist with any enquiries that we had. Their English was superb and were happy to entertain my "malo" attempt at conversing in Spanish. The fact that a security guard was present 24 hours a day in the lobby was also comforting. Again, they were friendly and not gung-ho. Fourthly value for money - considering the price and all of the aforementioned, this hotel is an absolute bargain. I would highly recommend this hotel to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: Stasnyc
Reviews.Content: Great value for your money Will recomend to all my friens, who is on the budget

Reviews.Title: “Great location at an excellent price”
Reviews.Author: simsu66
Reviews.Content: For a combination of location, price, service, and size of rooms this is probably the best city centre hotel I have stayed in. The service was excellent and the receptionist spoke very good English. On arrival we were given an introductory gift of a box of sweets, H2O Spa toiletries, souvenir wine book and note pad. I know toiletries are routinely supplied by hotels but it was a nice touch to personally give them to you in a small travel bag and they were in addition to those already in the room. We stayed in room 101 or 'Malaga.' The room was simply and nicely decorated and was a fair size. The bathroom was spacious and far bigger than most you find in a 3* hotel. The El Prado is centrally located and very close to the lively Plaza Sant Ana where there are numerous restaurants and tapas bars. Our favourite was El Lacon a couple of blocks away where we shared an excellent seafood platter for 20Euros. I have stayed in hotels with bigger rooms and more facilities but for location and budget the El Prado is well worthy of 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - super location, clean and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: citybreak17
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend the El Prado to any traveller looking for a hotel that offers a central location, value for money and good service. From start to finish to hotel staff were helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel is within easy reach of the majority of tourist hotspots, we barely used the Metro all weekend. The Parque El Retiro was at the end of the road, along with the Prado Museum. The rooms were cleaned everyday and were spotless. The facilities in the room were in great condition and we did not encounter any problems during the stay. Definitely recommend it, an excellent 3* hotel in a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good staff”
Reviews.Author: Gungadin
Reviews.Content: Our room on the 6th floor had a privatish ( neighbors across the street) terrace for which we did not pay extra. The room was very clean and the breakfast was good . The room was small but perfectly adequate and the bathroom good too. We walked to all the museums etc with no problems . I really enjoyed this hotel and can reccomend it without exception for anyone who wants a budget friendly place in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “good area”
Reviews.Author: nette_m
Reviews.Content: they have friendly and helpful staff. hotel is located close to museums and not too far from metro

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: acemiller211
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect. Could walk to everything. Breakfast is included which was very nice. There was no hot water one day, which was extremely disappointing. Our room on the 6th floor had a balcony, but was nothing special. Friendly staff. Great value for the price. Located right next to Plaza Santa Ana which was full of life until 2 am. Walking distance to the museums. Rooms and beds were small.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DLMCalifornia_USA
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Madrid Barajas airport just before 8AM and hopped on the Metro to head to our destination. We took the #8 line to the Nuevos Ministerios station and transferred to the #10 line. At the Tribunal station, we transferred again to the #1 line and then got off at the Anton Martin station. While there were some stairs involved in the transfers up until this point, the most difficult part was coming out of the Anton Martin station itself (with luggage) as the stairs seemed unending. In retrospect, we should have looked for an elevator, a different exit, or taken a taxi. After that, it was an easy few blocks to the hotel. Although the hotel is not located on some grand avenue, it is close to the Plaza Santa Ana, the Reina Sofia and Prado Museums, the old part of Madrid, Plaza Del Sol, and the Retiro Park. All are within easy walking distance. We arrived at the hotel mid-morning prior to check-in time and there were no rooms yet available. However, the front desk staff was very accommodating; storing our luggage and offering us an internet connection in the lobby while we waited. After using the internet and seeing some sights, we returned to the front desk and were given a room (still before check-in time). Although in an old part of Madrid, the hotel is modern and seems to be of contemporary construction. The room was very clean and modern, with laminate floors, a table/chair, TV, refrigerator/mini-bar, night-stands, luggage platform, and a closet with free safe. The wireless internet was the best we had of our 4 hotels in Europe. It was free, unlimited, performed well, and was easy to connect to (just like a wireless router at home). As is often the case in Europe, a "double standard" room gives you two twin beds pushed together. My one minor complaint was that the window to our room was frosted and opened to an internal fire escape exit stairwell. As we booked through a tour company, I'm not sure if we were entitled to a better view or not. However, one benefit of this location was that there was absolutely no outside noise in the room. We did not include the breakfast option; choosing instead to find local cafes. For dinner, we liked the Lateral restaurant in the Plaza Santa Ana. We left Madrid after an easy (downhill) walk to the Atocha Train Station. However, if one arrived from the station, it would involve an uphill walk to the hotel... We would certainly stay here again if we went back to Madrid...

Reviews.Title: “great service, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: BostoninAMS
Reviews.Content: they were helpful for the most part. the chair turned cot isnt too hot, but otherwise the rooms were nice. we also had a minivan because there were 6 of us and they let us park out front overnight free because we couldnt fit in the garage. also close to Casa Pata for traditional flemenco about 5 minute walk. then also a cuban place about 1 minute away had fantastic food, atmosphere and food

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with (unfortunately) great acoustics”
Reviews.Author: elanamig
Reviews.Content: We truly enjoyed the hotel, although the area around it did not impress us much. The hotel was clean and so was our room. Again, we had one double bed instead of two singles. We were woried about the street noise, but that was never the problem. Our room, 506, was facing the "main" street, but were were on the fifth floor, and the room had double windows and two sets of heavy curtains, so the outside noise seemed very remote and did not bother us at all. The staff was wonderful, and helped us with the reservations. The hotel had free WI-FI. The setup was not so great, though, and we had internet only 2 out of 5 nights. The hotel does have a PC for public use downstairs, so that compensated a bit. Our one complaint about the Hotel Prado is that it has excellent acoustics. We could hear the housekeeping at 7:30 in the morning. We could hear people in the halls talking, heels clicking, doors shutting and opening. No one was trying to be particularly loud, but we heard them loud and clear anyway. Like it or not, we would wake up at around 7:30 -8am every day. And since we rarely went to sleep before 2am in Madrid, we were pretty sleep deprived during our stay. Hotel El Prado is located near Plaza Sta Anna and about a 5 minute walk from the Anton Martin train station. The location is convenient for everything. The museums, the Plaza's, the Royal Palace are within walking distance. The Atocha Renfe train station is on the same line as Anton Martin station, and that was also convenient. The only thing we did not like about the location are the littered (and smelly!!!) streets. Calle de Leon (which leads from the metro station to the hotel) stank pretty badly... But then again, we passed this street only twice a day (once in the morning and once at night), so it was not a big deal... But it WOULD have been nicer if it was in a better aesthetic condition...

Reviews.Title: “Great service and good value”
Reviews.Author: Deeniebobeenie
Reviews.Content: My mother and I went on a trip to Madrid and stayed at the Hotel El Prado for 4 nights. The hotel is well located, close to Museo El Prado and the Thyssen Museum, as well as a short walk from Atocha station, useful if you plan to venture away from Madrid. If you would prefer to stay closer to the livelier parts of Madrid, e.g. Plaza Mayor, then there are many hotels in that area that are closer than Hotel El Prado is, but nevertheless it takes about 15 minutes to walk there from the hotel. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and friendly, on arrival we were warmly welcomed and given a complimentary box of chocolates, which was a nice touch. The rooms are wine themed and each room has a wine guide. Our room had two twin beds and was of ample size, very good cleanliness and well equipped with a safe, TV, fridge, etc. While I was there I did see a single room, which was tiny, so I would probably only recommend this hotel if you are travelling in a larger party. The breakfast comes in three price tariffs, and overall there is a good variety of fresh fruit, pastries, etc. When we stayed there, there was a 2 for 1 offer on breakfast, which came in handy. Overall the hotel and its staff are very good and I would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone who wants a comfortable, value for money hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Holtster
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on route to South America. Read reviews from Tripadvisor and we were very pleased with the hotel. From the Airport we got the metro and got off at Anton Martin.It cost 4 euros between the two of us. Watch out on the Metro as there are theives about so be on your guard.
