Once you get off at Anton Martin you then walk down Calle del Leon and the hotel is just to your left at the end of the street. The hotel was very modern and clean. Our room had air conditioning which we needed in the 38 degree heat. The towels were changed every day and 3 different prices of breakfast were available. The hotel is in a great location with lots of restaurants and bars around and within walking distance of all the main sights. It took us about 15 minutes to walk to the Palacio Real. Would recommend this hotel and if we visited Madrid again we would stay at the Hotel El Prado again. For anyone into football we visited Read Madrid's statudim and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HAMELFAMILY
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. We were lucky enough to get a room with a small deck on the top floor. We were on the side street so had no noise problems. Our room was large and clean. The staff was helpful The location couldn't be better: near all the major museums, the train station and multiple tapas bars. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalot!
Reviews.Content: Hi, My family and I (husband and 3 year old son) stayed at this hotel from May 19, 2009 to May 21, 2009 and then again for one night on May 25, 2009. We thought that this hotel was excellent. The location was priceless. We could walk everywhere in central Madrid from this location. We thought that the double room was quite large by European standards and the washroom extremely large. The room and hotel in general were very clean. We knew when we booked this hotel that it was not a luxury hotel but then again we were not wanting to pay outrageous prices. I think I was pleasantly surprised by how nice everything was here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Service and Very Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Beto_Rios
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor's recommendations. We stayed early May this year. It is pretty close to Anton Martin Metro station (5 min walk) and at walking distance you can reach the Prado Museum, Cibeles Fountain, Plaza del Sol and Plaza Mayor to name just a few. We highly recommend this hotel because of it's great location and commodity. In the vecinity you can find a lot of ammenities such as restaurants and bars for almost every taste. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Nina421
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel influenced by reviews here in Trip Advisor, by it's location on the map and by its good price and my friend and me did not regret it at all! By taking three but easy Metro Lines from the airport of Barajas (T4), the hotel is a very short walk from the Anton Martin Metro station, just walk up the Calle de Leon (vertical to Calle de Atocha) and then just left to Calle de Prado. The reception area is small, but check in was fast and the staff spoke good English. Our room was number 405, spacious bedroom, spacious bathroom, big closet, very clean, very nicely organised. I was very tired when I arrived so I thought I'd take a shower and get a little sleep. Well, the shower was so good I didn't want to get out, perfect water pressure, perfect shower-head, I was literally moaning! And apart from the usual toiletries, they gave a small sponge too, a sponge, never had this in a hotel before! Big fluffy towels finished the delight. And then the bed, well, again a perfect mattress with smooth sheets. As any tired traveller would say, this is heaven! Breakfast was included in the price we paid, and it was a very good buffet. Advice: go early if you want not to miss the churros, they are the first to disappear in the morning! And we come to location, location, location. If you want to explore Madrid, you cannot pick a better place as your home-base. It's literally evenly away from all the major attractions, all within walking distances. For the El Prado Museum, the Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, the Reina Sofia and the Retiro Park all you need is your feet. And if you want to go shopping, again Plaza del Sol, Plaza Major and so many others are very close, perfect to go back, leave your first batch of bags in the room and continue. You won't get hungry at all, all the nearby streets are filled with restaurants. And most important, it is a lively but safe neighbourhood, we were two women, nobody ever bothered us. Bathroom/room treats (see image): bath sponge, razor kit, comb, soap, shower cap, toothbrush & paste, shampoo/shower gel, in the room safe-box, sewing kit and shoe-shine sponge. The room does not have coffee/tea making facilities, but there is a 24h coffee/tea maker in the corridor opposite the reception. All in all, this hotel was our home in Madrid. We've been to many hotels in many countries, and this is among the best, beating even 4 star ones! Could not recommend it enough and will definitely stay there again if I visit Madrid again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: E_G_TATel_Aviv
Reviews.Content: Ideally located in the heart of the city center, walking distance to all major attractions and metro stations, area packed with restaurants and bars. The hotel is nicely renovated and decorated. Rooms are nice and clean. Cozy breakfast room with choice of buffet / continental / spanish breakfast. Free internet stations in hotel loby, free Wifi (although in our room it was a bit hard to get a connection with my cellphone wifi). The street has little traffic, but note that noise can be expected till late hours by people in the street, or by utility services early in the morning. Great value for a good price 65 - 100 Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: terziCT
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel 2 months in advance based on the reviews I read on tripadvisor. Due to early booking I've recieved a great rate. Rooms were spacious enough for 3 adults. Personel was very helpful and spoke perfect English. The only issue we had was the street noise but I think that's acceptable considering Madrid never sleeps :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: katarob
Reviews.Content: My family had 2 rooms, numbers 201 and 203. I found the rooms and bathroom to be of good size. Everything was very clean and modern. Room 201 was a triple, it looked to be the same size as 203 , however it didn't look cramped. The hotel is best described as no frills , but comfortable and modern. It barely has a lobby and no bellboy or concierge. We got a fantastic early booking rate with this hotel, 85 Euros per night per room, taxes included. For the location and type of rooms, that can't be beat. Free internet is offered in the lobby area. We found the staff at reception to be friendly and helpful (we dealt with three different shifts). The only exception was one woman, she appeared surly. I think part of the reason was that she was a trainee and was nervous. Not a big deal to me . For that kind of rate even a little higher, I would definitively stay at El Prado again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Baja78
Reviews.Content: Everything was impecable, i highly recomend for turist or people on bussines. Its in the center and has access to turist places.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service, but beware of the single room”
Reviews.Author: ScottDCtraveler
Reviews.Content: There's no doubt that the Hotel El Prado has an excellent location right in the heart of Madrid's Cortes neighborhood, within easy walking distance of many major attractions, several subway stops and an endless variety of restaurants. The staff are friendly and helpful, and the place is well maintained. It is surely a wonderful deal for Madrid. It falls short of excellent overall for the traveler such as myself who books a single room, though. My room was "landlocked" within the building, with the only "window" being a portal to a hallway. So, if you like waking up to daylight, you're out of luck. There was minimal ventilation; my room was too hot, and there was nothing the staff could do about it. Also, with no carpeting in the halls or rooms, and thin walls, there's a lot of noise, so my earplugs were essential. That said, I believe all the other rooms face the outside in some way, so I can recommend for others; for the single rooms, just be aware of what you might be getting.

Reviews.Title: “Close to anything you need.”
Reviews.Author: Letsgo75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel El Prado for four nights from 1st September 2008. Staff were very friendly and spoke English, which made it much easier for me. The hotel is within walking distance to most things of interest, and also to the Metro and bus if you need to use them. Breakfast was nice and there was also a computer in reception with free internet access. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, and the Indian restaurant around the corner was my favouite. I really enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel is a Real Jewel!”
Reviews.Author: Phaed0
Reviews.Content: We stayed in four different hotels during our recent trip to Spain and Hotel El Prado was by far our favorite, AND the best value. The location couldn't have been better for our primary mission which was to spend time in Madrid's "big 3" art museums (Prado, Thyssen, Reina Sofia). But for getting to other parts of the city there are metro* stations just a couple of blocks to the North and South of the hotel, and the Atocha Renfe station is within walking distance for out-of-town excursions via bullet train. The neighborhood is great for strolling around and there are many restaurants (though here as elsewhere in Spain we found few good ones). Our room on the 6th floor was spotless and included an outdoor patio with a wonderful sunrise view over neighborhood rooftops. Everything worked, including the heat/air system which was quiet and precise (something we came to appreciate during this trip). Free WiFi was much appreciated and we made frequent use of it. But most of all, the hotel staff was professional, accommodating and always friendly and welcoming - something we found woefully lacking at other Spanish hotels and most restaurants. *Some further words on Madrid's excellent Metro system: It quickly and efficiently takes you just about anywhere in the city for E1,20. For 2 Euros (vs 30 Euros for a taxi) you can safely travel to or from the airport in about 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Not Hapy”
Reviews.Author: Erkmen
Reviews.Content: I am making most of my hotel bookings by tips at TA and this is the first time I was let down.. We booked our room through hotel website. I have selected the two rooms option and two adults and double bed accupancy. We got a rate of 196 Euro per two night, two room with double occupancy for two adults including tax. However when we were at the hotel after 5 hrs of car travel from Sevilla, the hotel claimed that there is a mistake and this charge is for single use and the normal rate for double use will be 103 euro per night. It was clearly stated at the hotels reservation document as our reservation to be double use, But we didnt argue as there was only 5-6 euro difference from their claimed price and stayed at the hotel. The hotel is in the old part of Madrid, close distance to most attractions. The rooms are cosy, not very modern, but nice and comfortable. There is free wifi and also computers at the entrance, which is a big challenge for me.. When we checked out from the hotel, they have asked 220,4 Euros from us. we have said that we booked as 196 Euro, later on, you have said that it will be 103 Euro per night which shall be 206 Euros. But they said its 103 Euro + tax. Our first reservation was 196 Euro including tax, but we have paid 220 Euro including tax.. I felt as ripped off and will definitely not visit this hotel, not because its a bad hotel, but because I didnt like the way they act. If I knew that I will be charged as 220 Euros, For the same price I could choose a different and better hotel,..

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: DLAlabama
Reviews.Content: Great location in old Madrid. Big rooms (even by US standards), hardwood floors, large bathrooms, great staff, the little extras (free snacks, etc.) Definitely would return! If going to Madrid, take a tip from me and book here. Just don't order the pizza---it's vile.

Reviews.Title: “Base Camp”
Reviews.Author: Rince_Sporium
Reviews.Content: I wanted to see and experience Madrid. I wanted to be in the centre of the city. I didnt care about views. I wanted a clean, comfortable, secure room at a reasonable cost. this Hotel ticked all the boxes. The room was lovely. Modern furniture, good spacious bright bathroom. I was in the attic so I could see the roofs of all the other adjoining buildings. That was interesting to see the roofscape of a different country. I would think that most other rooms dont have much of a view. I just got lucky. I did not take the hotel breakfast, instead I got elsewhere. Save some money and have more variety elsewhere. Oh, I just remembered, the lift was intermittently faulty. Sometimes it worked sometimes it didnt. Many flights of stairs to my room ! My trip was primarily to see Galleries ...Prado / Reina Sofia / Thyssen.... this Hotel is only 5 - 10 min walk to them all

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabel_2
Reviews.Content: Hotel El Prado Very comfortable modern hotel in great location in center of Madrid. Everything looked like photos on web and it had everything you could need – TV with CNN, AC, lift, minibar, spotlessly clean. Free internet on computer in lobby. Staff spoke English. Breakfast was extra but you could just have coffee and a pastry for €3.50 or more extensive choices for more money. Two minute walk from Plaza Santa Ana, 5-10 from Plaza Mayor. Five to ten minutes in other direction is the Prado. Atocha train station about 15 minute walk, Several metro stops nearby. My only complaint was that my single room didn’t have a real window – the window opened onto a utility hallway, so no daylight. But I think there was only one room like this per floor and other than that it was perfectly fine and it certainly was quiet. The location felt very safe even at night. €67/night plus tax and breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Vovchik
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 4 nights early october. We found the location to be spectacular, right in the center close to everything. We lucked out by getting the room on the 5th floor. The streets are filled easily until 1 to 2am in the morning, so having a room on the 5th floor and windows closed worked at keeping the noise out fairly well. The room (room 506) was very clean and descent size, with nice size closet and safe. The bathroom was also spacious, could use some fixing, but still in a very good shape and clean. The hotel had free internet in the lobby and receptionist were very friendly at assisting us with booking Toledo trip. Breakfast is very typical for spain, cold cuts, pastries, coffee and juices. Overall a great stay for the price, awsome location! (25 euros to and from airport by taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Super central location”
Reviews.Author: dgcCambs
Reviews.Content: Simple, very clean, rooms reasonable size and well equipped for a city centre hotel at this price. My wife and I have no hesitation in recommending this for its friendly, helpful staff and very convenient location for old Madrid, all the Art galleries and the pretty, lively Plaza de Santa Ana with its bars and cafes. A room on the upper floors has more light and less noise but, hey we are in the centre of one of Europe's most dedicated all-night cities, so shut the window or take ear plugs if you are a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a great location”
Reviews.Author: ug97
Reviews.Content: We spent three days at this hotel. We were very pleased with it in terms of cleanliness, friendliness and location. I don't think we could have found a more perfect location for a first-time visit to Madrid, and with such great value. We used booking.com to book this hotel, and instead of the regular 12 euros for breakfast, we got breakfast for 5 euros. What a deal! The breakfast was one of the best we had in Madrid - meats, cheeses, pastries, yoghurts, cereal, juices, tortillas, coffee, tea...excellent value! The hotel itself is small, and the rooms are small but clean, comfortable and well-appointed. We were a bit disappointed that there was no kettle and iron, but quickly discovered that this is not common to find anywhere in Spain. The free internet access was a bonus, and there was always at least one staff member who spoke English. If you are a light sleeper, then definitely ask for an inside room. Ours looked out at the fire escape...not terribly inspiring, but our friends on the street side spent many nights awake, listening the rowdy crowds coming from bar-hopping. All in all, this hotel was great value and had great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: awa'_the_noo
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in May 2007. This is a small, unpretentious 3 star hotel very well situated for sightseeing. The Prado is a few minutes' walk and there are several other galleries nearby; the Metro is about 5-10 minutes' walk for access other parts of the city. The hotel claims to have a 'wine' theme for no obvious reason other than rooms being named after various wine regions! Although Madrid, like any European city centre, can be noisy, our room was extremely quiet. This was probably because we were given a room on the top floor, far above the street. An added bonus was the balcony, large enough for a table and two chairs, and not overlooked at all with an impressive view over the surrounding rooftops. The room and bathroom were very clean and bright. Breakfast was a good buffet, included in the room rate. Although there is no restaurant at the hotel, there are plenty of places to eat in the area. There have been some negative reports about the neighbourhood, but we felt safe walking around in the late evening. Thoroughly recommended as a no-frills base for exploring Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend it.....and we are picky!”
Reviews.Author: csteinStLouis
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at El Prado. A quick walk from the subway stop. We loved the location -very close to all the major tourist sites and within walking distance to the Plaza Mayor, Plaza de Santa Anna, our flamenco show (at Casa Patas) and many more! Our room was incredibly small but very nice with standard amenities. The bathroom was small but clean and nice. We would stay here again in a heartbeat because of the fabulous location. Breakfast was also very good!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: nancesantamonic
Reviews.Content: This hotel is comfortable and well situated...in a lovely neighborhood walking distance to the Prado Museum. We were two families traveling together during spring break when we stayed at the El Prado for four nights. When we arrived at our next destination we realized that we had left cash and travelers checks in our room safe...with the safe door open and unlocked! We called, and the person at the desk found it. Within some days we were able to arrange for the hotel to fed ex it to us in the US...with nothing missing. If we return to Madrid, we'll always stay in the El Prado.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: lucyfaraway
Reviews.Content: I booked a single, non-smoking room at El Prado for three nights. The hotel is very conveniently located. If you arrive by train to the main station in Madrid, just hop on the metro and get off at Anton Martin stop. The hotel is about five minute walk from there. Museums Thyssen and Prado are within 10 minutes walking distance.. You're in the Bourbon quarter of Madrid so everything is close. The hotel staff is very nice and actually help out with any questions. I stayed in room 607. I think it used to be a closet. See photos. Since I was traveling alone and not in need of alot of space I overlooked the size. I planned on being in the room only to sleep. There was a huge window in the room, which I thought would be an asset, but I was very disappointed when I opened it -- the view was of a hallway and stairs. The room was stifling hot and when I asked about the air I was told that the air conditioning would not get turned on until May 15. Not the best news especially if your window opens to a hallway. Also, you can pretty much hear everything going on in the hallway. Not so great to hear people late at night or early in the morning talking in the hall or hauling luggage. Again, I'm sure this might not be a problem in other rooms but I really do think my room used to be a utility closet of some kind that management decided to maximize as a room. But, I didn't ask anyone so that's entirely my assumption based on the size and location of the room. I have no idea what the other rooms are like because I didn't ask to see them. I would imagine they're nice because I have seen other photos from travelers who have stayed. I guess my point is that if you're asking for a single room, make sure it is not room 607. Also, if you plan on using their laundry services, keep in mind it can take up to 2 days to get your stuff back. I didn't ask beforehand how long it took and got a surprise about it. Overall, I would recommend Prado. The location is excellent to public transportation and the main sights of Madrid. There are plenty of eateries and unique shops nearby. The hotel staff was amiable and the hotel itself is nicely decorated and kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, but too much drunken noise”
Reviews.Author: WithMomDad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel El Prado from April 20th – 22nd. We paid US$156 per night, which included breakfast. The hotel is very well-located; walking distance to the Prado and the Thyssen. The metro was a 10 minute walk (with suitcases), but not a major inconvenience. The lobby is not very impressive, but the rooms were very nice and spacious, and the decoration modern. The water pressure in the shower was great and they provided many toiletries. There was a mini bar, color TV with remote, safe, and stereo system. We were very pleased with the room and location for the price we paid. That being said, the major problem was the street noise. We live in Manhattan, so are used to street noise, but the proximity to the Plaza Santa Ana meant there was a lot of noise from drunken revelers at wee hours in the morning. I was woken up several times due to singing, screaming, and loud talking from the people on the street leaving the bars, and I consider myself a deep sleeper. I can imagine this problem also occurs with other hotels in the area, so it’s not the hotel’s fault. Even though it was a great value, I probably would not stay in this hotel again, or any in that immediate area.

Reviews.Title: “5 Ladies from Wirral.”
Reviews.Author: Beb-bugle
Reviews.Content: Just a quick review! Great location, rooms, breakfast(included with octopus.com) clean, lovely sun terrace on 8th floor next to gym. Suitable for all ages.Very modern and clean. Take travel kettle. In room there is a fridge, hairdryer, tv, safe, toiletries, air con. BUT BEWARE!! I have never come across such rude and sullen staff in over 100 hotels before, especially the bloke with the glasses who shows you to the table at breakfast and the bar staff. The hotel bar shuts at 12, and there seemed to be no way of getting a drink after this.It does sound petty to dis the staff but there is never need for rudeness.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Louise66
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on TripAdvisor, we booked two nights accommodation at the Hotel El Prado in Madrid. The standard of accommodation was good and constitutes real value for money. In support of other reviews posted, there is alot of street noise on a Saturday night /Sunday morning (usually from car horns and good humoured late night revellers) so ask for 'quiet rooms'. The hotel is centrally located - near the Prado and Thyssen museums, with the nearest metro station, the Banco de Espana - five minutes walk. The rooms are clean and comfortable - the breakfast buffet was well worth the additional money.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base”
Reviews.Author: Breezer25
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Madrid with 2 friends in May. We chose the Hotel El Prado (aka Kris El Prado) because of previous reviews and it's location. The hotel was coming to the end of refurbistment while we were there but this was being completed distreetly and did not disturb our enjoyment. All the rooms have a wine theme not sure why that is. The rooms were bright airy and most importantly spotlessly clean. There were two good sized single beds, the third bed consisted of a camp bed placed between the wall and one of the other beds but there was still plenty of room betweem them. The windows were double glazed and blocked any noise that may have come from the street. There was a large wardrobe with plenty of storage for three girls and inluded a safety deposit box where you enter your own pin number upon arrival. The bathroom was a good size, modern and clean with a bathtub with a good shower head over it, hairdryer, vanity kit which included a razor and toothbrush and sewing kit. Breakfast was not included with our booking but was available at an additional cost of €9 per person per day. We didn't avail of this as we prefered to do as the locals do and eat in all the local cafe's instead. The staff were polite and very helpful towards us during our stay and they ordered a taxi to take us back to the airport. The hotel has a room to store luggage if you have a late flight and want to make the most of your last few hours in Madrid. The hotel is located on a nice street just a minutes walk to Santa Anna. We loved the location as it was within walking distance to all the sights. It also felt very safe. Santa Anna has beautiful bars and restaurants serving some very good tapas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location & value!”
Reviews.Author: chufa
Reviews.Content: Location: safe, central and convenient for tourists Double room: standard, clean, spacious, comfortable but no thrills Service: very good, every requests were met, friendly &helpful Breakfast: simple but reasonabily priced, you can choose from a cup of coffee( expresso) for €1.50, coffee & crossiant for €3.00, continental breakfast (coffee, juice & bread) for €5.00, or simple breakfast buffet for €10.00. Problems: little things in the room need to be fixed, e.g. patched /plastered wall need to be painted, rotten wooden door due to humidity in the bathroom (lack of ventilation), lobby and common area looks dull and old. Overall we think this hotel has good value. Booking over Internet is the recommanded way because of the lower price. Like other reviews, we also recommand taking the subway (metro) to and from the airport (i.e. if you do not have a lot of luggage). It is easy and cheap.... and beware of the dishonest taxi-driver!! You should make sure the meter is on. If you do not agree to the amount, before paying ask for the driver to give you a bill/receipt and seek help from the hotel reception or police!

Reviews.Title: “Well located and clean hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: KellyC
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a triple room in August 2006. The hotel was perfectly located. We could walk or subway everywhere we wanted to be. It was just over a 5 minute walk to the museums and Sol. The room was a little crammed for three people but worked just fine for us. And the room and bathroom were very updated and nice and clean. The hotel staff was good. They helped us make reservations for flamenco and gave us directions and advice on other sights which was great. But you definitely had to pull it out of them to ge tthem to help you, they were not immediately offering. But then again this is not the Ritz and they are front desk and not concierge staff so what can you expect? The woman that runs the breakfast room was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Clans53
Reviews.Content: This was my husband's and my first trip to Spain. I booked this hotel on the internet but we were traveling with our two twenty-something sons (one who is studying in Spain and one who works in Spain) and one son's Spanish girlfriend. The staff was very friendly and everyone enjoyed being able to check email for free. Our 2 rooms were very spacious and super clean. My only complaint was the noise from the street (we were on the 5th floor) as people laughed and celebrated on Friday night. Saturday night was quiet though. The location was great! We especially loved Miau, a tapas bar in Plaza Santa Ana just minutes from the hotel and ate there twice. We could also walk to the Prado and Reina Sofia (you must check out Guernica). There is a Cuban restaurant in the same block, Tocororo, that is listed in Frommers as the best Cuban restaurant in Madrid. The food and mojitos were great. And our favorite memory is the flamenco show at Casa Patas, which was also walking distance from the hotel. As we say in the States, we got a lot of bang for our buck!...location, friendly staff, comfortable beds and clean rooms. We paid 69 euros (double) & 79 euros(triple) for weekend rates. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmajumdar
Reviews.Content: Good value Madrid Hotel. Clean, conveniently located for all the major sightseeing, helpful staff, mercifully quiet (not always the case in Madrid). Free WI-FI a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: FilipeSilvaGuerra
Reviews.Content: I travel from Seixal, Portugal to Madrid with my family in May and we spent two nights in this hotel . It was the third time we choose Hotel El Prado to stay in Madrid. It is very well located, near the beautiful Plaza de Santa Ana and Plaza del Sol in the centre of Madrid. The rooms were nice and clean, we took the breakfast in the hotel and it was very good. All the personnel were very kind and friendly. The free internet is a plus. I don’t recommend the garage to park the car since it’s very small. I recommend this hotel. Filipe S. Guerra

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Germander
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel El Prado in both May and June this year (2006). In May for 3 nights and I requested a single room. This was quite a small, internal room, so had no window. But while small it was beautifully furnished, had a great bathroom, and was cosy and quiet. My next booking was for July, but as I had to return home due to ill-health I cancelled this, and the hotel was able to give me 3 nights accommodation in a double room. This room was on the 6th floor, a medium sized room, again well-furnished with a little balcony. And also very quiet. The hotel staff were extremely helpful and I cannot praise them enough. They did more for me than I would have expected. As I required 4 nights in Madrid, and they only had vacancies for the first 3, I was pleasantly surprised to find they had booked a hotel for my last night in the city. This saved me having to ring around local hotels, which I had expected to do. Staff were also happy to answer my questions about sightseeing, and provided all the information I could require, and I asked lots of questions! One morning I was to sick to get down to breakfast and rang reception to see if they could bring it to my room, and it was delivered within minutes. Breakfast was a delight, the only Spanish hotel I came across that gave a choice of prices for breakfast. For example just tea or coffee was 1.50euros; a light breakfast of beverage, OJ, croissants, cereal etc was 5euros; while a full buffet breakfast was 10euros (standard price in Spain). The selection of food was really good. The hotel's location is great, within walking distance of all the major museums and monuments, and just 20 mins walk from the Cathedral and Royal Palace. I understand the metro is close, but couldn't see the point in using it as I could walk everywhere. Plaza Santa Ana is just 2 mins away, very easy for snacks or an evening meal close to the hotel. I would stay in this hotel again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location--wine info a plus”
Reviews.Author: kenito799
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel for Madrid and we would definitely stay here again. We spent 3 nights in June 2006, booked thru go-today.com and so breakfast was included. The breakfast was markedly better than at our hotel in Barcelona, with really good pastries, fresh fruit, ham, cheese, yogurt, and an automatic espresso machine which was acceptable (although for coffee you are better off with real cafe con leche or cortado anywhere they serve coffee in Spain). If you ask for a quiet room they might put you in a back room with no view but SILENT and dark whenever you want to sleep. The hotel has a "wine theme" with rooms named after wine regions of Spain. A big plus for wine lovers is a free booklet with a wealth of information about Spanish wine. If you are planning a wine tour, stay here first and set off to La Rioja or the Basque country with this booklet. The rooms are clean, comfortable with nice bathrooms and towels. The location is excellent, a block from the always happening Plaza Santa Ana and easily walkable to all the sights of old Madrid. The streets are quite safe since there is so much activity all night long--but Calle El Prado is a narrow, fairly quiet street. Really there is no better location for tapas crawling, which after all is a major highlight of Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, good location, bad service”
Reviews.Author: butterfly00
Reviews.Content: The staff is unhelpful and treats every question/request as a rude interruption of their day of chitchat. However, the hotel is quite nice. Our room was very nice - wood floors, comfortable beds, fairly spacious and large bathroom compared to the other 4 European hotels we stayed at during this vacation. We were only in Madrid for a day and a half (two nights in the hotel), so the hotel's central location was very helpful - you could walk to Plaza Mayor and to the Prado Museum (and all the other museums right next to it + the botanical gardens) easily. The royal palace was a bit of a longer walk - we took a cab one way and walked the other. The hotel is definitely in the center of all the tourist sites, but if you walk on certain side streets things get a bit shady. In the future, I'd rather stay a bit closer to Plaza Mayor and the royal palace (where all the embassies and nicer hotels seem to be) than where this hotel is. In its specific area, Hotel Kris El Prado seems to be the higher end of hotels - most of the other places to stay within a 3-block vicinity were hostels and very low-budget hotels, and I felt surrounded by student backpackers, low-budget travelers and shady locals when I walked in the wrong direction. (If you walk towards the tourist sites, everything's fine.) I would stay at the hotel again, though, because the price was very good, the location convenient and the rooms very nice. Note that breakfast is not included. There's a computer in the lobby with Internet access that guests can use for free.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: thetravelbum
Reviews.Content: This cute little hotel was centrally located, between Museo del Prado and the Palacio Real, very close to the heart of nightlife and Tapas Bars. Everything that we wanted to see was in walking distance. I can't imagine there is a better hotel for the price we paid, especially since the room we stayed in was large and clean. The only reason why I wouldn't give it an excellent rating is because the service at the front desk was not very friendly or helpful, but at least they spoke English.

HotelInfo.Name: All Seasons Madrid Prado
HotelInfo.Address: Calle el Prado 11, 28014 Madrid, Spain
